title: Why Attention Is the Gateway to Learning
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Attention Is the Gateway to Learning.

hook.text: You read the whole page but remember nothing. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: Without attention, sensory input never reaches working memory.

discovery.text: Attention acts as a filter, letting only selected signals through.

twist.text: Multitasking doesn't split attentionâ€”it rapidly switches it, losing data.

climax.text: Directing attention deliberately is the first skill of effective learning.

punchline.text: If attention is the gate, you hold the key.

quiz.question: Why does multitasking hurt learning?
options: It forces rapid attention switching, losing information
